_header: High in the heavens figure circular
_description: The Kingis Quair, ascribed to James I of Scotland — 197 stanzas rhyme royal

BodArcSelB24.First Lines:
Heigh In the hevynnis figure circulereThe rody sterres twynklyng as
                    the fyre…
BodArcSelB24.Last Lines:
…I recommend my buk In lynis sevinAnd eke thair saulis vnto
                    þe bliss of hevin
BodArcSelB24.Attributed Author:
Heirefter followis the quair Maid be King Iames of scotland þe ferst
                    callit þe kingis quair and Maid quhan his Ma wes In England (f.
                        191v); Quod Iacobus primus scotorum rex Illustrissimus (f.
                    211)
BodArcSelB24.Attributed Title:
Heirefter followis the quair Maid be King Iames of scotland þe ferst
                    callit þe kingis quair and Maid quhan his Ma wes In England (f.
                        191v)
